goals.question: What is the average temperature distribution in Seattle throughout the year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average temperature by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the seasonal temperature changes in Seattle and identify the months with the highest and lowest temperatures.

goals.question: What is the distribution of precipitation in Seattle throughout the year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average precipitation by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the seasonal precipitation changes in Seattle and identify the months with the highest and lowest precipitation levels.

goals.question: What is the relationship between temperature and humidity in Seattle?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of temperature vs humidity
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the correlation between temperature and humidity in Seattle and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wind speed in Seattle throughout the year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average wind speed by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the seasonal wind speed changes in Seattle and identify the months with the highest and lowest wind speeds.

goals.question: What is the distribution of cloud cover in Seattle throughout the year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average cloud cover by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the seasonal cloud cover changes in Seattle and identify the months with the highest and lowest cloud cover levels.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['DATE'] = pd.to_datetime(data['DATE'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['DATE'])]
    data['MONTH'] = data['DATE'].dt.month
    monthly_avg_temp = data.groupby('MONTH')['TEMP'].mean()

    plt.plot(monthly_avg_temp.index, monthly_avg_temp.values, label='Average Temperature')
    plt.xlabel('Month')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature (°F)')
    plt.title('What is the average temperature distribution in Seattle throughout the year?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(range(1, 13), ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'])
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['DATE'] = pd.to_datetime(data['DATE'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['DATE'])]
    data['MONTH'] = data['DATE'].dt.month
    monthly_precipitation = data.groupby('MONTH')['PRCP'].mean()

    plt.plot(monthly_precipitation.index, monthly_precipitation.values, label='Average Precipitation')
    plt.xlabel('Month')
    plt.ylabel('Precipitation (inches)')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of precipitation in Seattle throughout the year?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(range(1, 13), ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'])
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['temperature'], data['humidity'])
    plt.xlabel('Temperature')
    plt.ylabel('Humidity')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between temperature and humidity in Seattle?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(['Temperature vs Humidity'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['DATE'] = pd.to_datetime(data['DATE'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['DATE'])]
    data['MONTH'] = data['DATE'].dt.month
    monthly_wind_speed = data.groupby('MONTH')['WND_SPD'].mean()

    plt.plot(monthly_wind_speed.index, monthly_wind_speed.values)
    plt.xlabel('Month')
    plt.ylabel('Average Wind Speed')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wind speed in Seattle throughout the year?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(range(1, 13), ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'])
    plt.legend(['Average Wind Speed'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month
    monthly_avg_cloud_cover = data.groupby('month')['cloud_cover'].mean()

    plt.plot(monthly_avg_cloud_cover.index, monthly_avg_cloud_cover.values, label='Average Cloud Cover')
    plt.xlabel('Month')
    plt.ylabel('Average Cloud Cover')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of cloud cover in Seattle throughout the year?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
